<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return true if we can prove that the given load (which is assumed to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// within the specified loop) would access only dereferenceable memory, and</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// its placement within the loop. (i.e. does not require predication beyond</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that required by the header itself and could be hoisted into the header</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// address loaded from is analyzeable by SCEV.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlibraryinfo">TargetLibraryInfo</a> &#42;TLI = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return true if speculation of the given load must be suppressed to avoid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ordering or interfering with an active sanitizer.  If not suppressed,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// dereferenceability and alignment must be proven separately.  Note: This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is only needed for raw reasoning; if you use the interface below</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute), this is handled internally.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a423120c6a3bab0386276333090b574f8">mustSuppressSpeculation</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &amp;LI);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The default number of maximum instructions to scan in the block, used by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FindAvailableLoadedValue().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">extern</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;unsigned&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ac27b929f0de70e1336a7ab5248861">DefMaxInstsToScan</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Scan backwards to see if we have the value of the given load available</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// locally within a small number of instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// You can use this function to scan across multiple blocks: after you call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this function, if ScanFrom points at the beginning of the block, it&#39;s safe</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to continue scanning the predecessors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that performing load CSE requires special care to make sure the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// metadata is set appropriately.  In particular, aliasing metadata needs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to be merged.  (This doesn&#39;t matter for store-to-load forwarding because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the only relevant load gets deleted.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param Load The load we want to replace.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param ScanBB The basic block to scan.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param &#91;in,out&#93; ScanFrom The location to start scanning from. When this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function returns, it points at the last instruction scanned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param MaxInstsToScan The maximum number of instructions to scan. If this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is zero, the whole block will be scanned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param AA Optional pointer to alias analysis, to make the scan more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// precise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param &#91;out&#93; IsLoadCSE Whether the returned value is a load from the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// location in memory, as opposed to the value operand of a store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\returns The found value, or nullptr if no value is found.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a459b627931605e520bf7d14e074af7c1">FindAvailableLoadedValue</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42;Load, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;ScanBB,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> &amp;ScanFrom,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxInstsToScan = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ac27b929f0de70e1336a7ab5248861">DefMaxInstsToScan</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;IsLoadCSE = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;NumScanedInst = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This overload provides a more efficient implementation of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FindAvailableLoadedValue() for the case where we are not interested in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// finding the closest clobbering instruction if no available load is found.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This overload cannot be used to scan across multiple blocks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a459b627931605e520bf7d14e074af7c1">FindAvailableLoadedValue</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42;Load, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;IsLoadCSE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxInstsToScan = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ac27b929f0de70e1336a7ab5248861">DefMaxInstsToScan</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Scan backwards to see if we have the value of the given pointer available</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// locally within a small number of instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// You can use this function to scan across multiple blocks: after you call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this function, if ScanFrom points at the beginning of the block, it&#39;s safe</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to continue scanning the predecessors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param Loc The location we want the load and store to originate from.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param AccessTy The access type of the pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param AtLeastAtomic Are we looking for at-least an atomic load/store ? In</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// case it is false, we can return an atomic or non-atomic load or store. In</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// case it is true, we need to return an atomic load or store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param ScanBB The basic block to scan.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param &#91;in,out&#93; ScanFrom The location to start scanning from. When this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function returns, it points at the last instruction scanned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param MaxInstsToScan The maximum number of instructions to scan. If this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is zero, the whole block will be scanned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param AA Optional pointer to alias analysis, to make the scan more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// precise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param &#91;out&#93; IsLoadCSE Whether the returned value is a load from the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// location in memory, as opposed to the value operand of a store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\returns The found value, or nullptr if no value is found.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b303a16e5a77e48c8e724c52a3abbff">findAvailablePtrLoadStore</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loc">Loc</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;AccessTy,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AtLeastAtomic, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;ScanBB,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> &amp;ScanFrom,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxInstsToScan, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;IsLoadCSE, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;NumScanedInst);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns true if a pointer value \\p From can be replaced with another pointer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value \\To if they are deemed equal through some means (e.g. information from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// conditions).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// NOTE: The current implementation allows replacement in Icmp and PtrToInt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions, as well as when we are replacing with a null pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Additionally it also allows replacement of pointers when both pointers have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the same underlying object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6f5cd5733f1f4d2254248b60fb8a937f">canReplacePointersIfEqual</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;From, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;To,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>);</span></CodeLine>
